Description of incident: Sometime late last year, an employee              of a McLean investment firm used the online file-sharing network LimeWire.              In doing so, he inadvertently opened the private files of his firm              to the public. That exposed the names, dates of birth and Social Security              numbers of about 2,000 of the firm's clients, including a number of              high-powered lawyers and Supreme Court Justice Stephen G. Breyer.
